songInfo.title: You Shook Me All Night Long

techniques.name: Groove-Based Power Chords
techniques.description: Malcolm Young's signature pocket rhythm playing with emphasis on groove over speed

notes: Focus on the groove rather than strict timing
Slight swing feel creates the characteristic AC/DC pocket
Clean chord transitions are essential for the flow
sequence: Master basic G5, C5, D5 power chord shapes
Practice chord transitions slowly and cleanly
Add groove and pocket timing gradually
Incorporate selective palm muting for dynamics
tips: Practice with a metronome but allow for slight timing variations
Use selective palm muting to create dynamics
Keep the right hand relaxed for the groove feel

techniques.name: Pentatonic Lead Fills
techniques.description: Simple but effective pentatonic runs in the style of Angus Young

notes: 12th fret position is the sweet spot for this song
Focus on melodic phrasing over technical complexity
Use slight bends and vibrato for expression
sequence: Learn G major pentatonic scale in 12th position
Practice simple ascending and descending runs
Add bends and vibrato for expression
tips: Start with simple runs before attempting complex fills
Listen to the original recording for phrasing ideas
Practice the pentatonic scale until it's automatic
details.progression: G major pentatonic scale - 12th fret position

techniques.name: Selective Palm Muting
techniques.description: Strategic use of palm muting to create dynamic contrast

notes: Not full palm muting - just touch the strings lightly
Use during verses for contrast with open choruses
Creates the chunky rhythm sound AC/DC is known for
sequence: Learn to switch between muted and open quickly
tips: Practice switching between muted and open quickly
Keep the muting consistent across all strings
Don't over-mute - you still want chord clarity
details.progression: Applied to rhythm sections for tonal variety

sections.name: Main Riff/Intro
sections.description: The iconic opening riff that establishes the groove and sets up the entire song
notes: Establishes the pocket groove that defines the song
Use consistent downstrokes for the chunky sound
Focus on the rhythm more than the notes themselves

sections.name: Verse
sections.description: Classic verse progression with selective palm muting creating dynamic interest
notes: Use selective palm muting on the G5 for verses
Keep chord transitions clean and smooth
Maintain the groove pocket throughout

sections.name: Chorus
sections.description: Open, driving chorus with the classic AC/DC power chord progression
notes: Open, ringing chords without palm muting
Emphasize the D5 to G5 resolution
Stronger attack on chorus for dynamic lift

sections.name: Bridge
sections.description: Breakdown section that builds tension before returning to the main groove
notes: Slightly different chord order creates tension
Build intensity through the progression
Sets up the return to the main riff perfectly

sections.name: Guitar Solo
sections.description: Classic Angus Young solo featuring G major pentatonic runs with melodic phrasing
notes: Focus on the 12th fret pentatonic position
Use bends and vibrato for expression
Melodic phrasing over technical complexity

guitar.pickup: Humbucker pickups for full, warm tone

effects.other: None - guitar straight into amp for pure tone
